poem:
Title: Chrysalis

Silence, the shuffling Senate speaks,
A nation's unborn hope they seek.
Beneath the eiderdown of law,
A shiver of life in frosty jaw.
Alabama dreams, cold and maternal,
Now caught in a crucible, eternal.
Clinics close, the heart refills,
Awaiting the thaw of political will.
Bitter is the battle fought,
For the chance of a cradle-sought.
